Borgata Hotel Casino& Spa是一家在美国新泽西州大西洋城的酒店、赌场兼温泉。它由MGM Resorts International拥有和经营。这家赌场酒店拥有 2,798 间客房，是新泽西州最大的酒店。Borgata 于 2003 年 7 月开业，是大西洋城收入最高的赌场。

 

历史

Borgata 是大西洋城一个名为“The Tunnel Project”的大型项目的一部分，该项目于 1999 年左右开始。当史蒂夫·永利在大西洋城规划Le Jardin时，他想建造一个价值 3.3 亿美元的 2.5 英里（4.0 公里）隧道，从大西洋开始通往新度假村的城市高速公路，后来被命名为大西洋城-布里根廷纽带，它将把大西洋城高速公路的传入交通汇入该市的码头区。这引起了很大的争议，因为它会穿过一个居民区。竞争对手唐纳德特朗普起诉永利，称这是通往永利赌场的“车道”。即使在 Le Jardin 被取消之后，隧道项目也确实取得了进展，并最终于 2001 年开放。

 

Borgata 于 2003 年 7 月 2 日晚上 11:45 开业，是MGM Mirage和Boyd Gaming的合资企业。主塔 - 大西洋城第三高的建筑 - 由于其反光的金色玻璃外墙，从数英里外都可以看到。拉斯维加斯的Marnell Corrao Associates公司和费城的 Bower Lewis and Thrower Architects (BLT) 也参与了该项目。

 

2005 年底和 2006 年初，Borgata 进行了 2 亿美元的赌场和零售扩张，新翼于 2006 年 6 月开业。作为扩张的一部分，Borgata 安装了大西洋城最大的扑克室。2008 年 6 月，Borgata 开设了第二家酒店The Water Club。

 

2010 年初，有报道称MGM Mirage可能出售其在 Borgata 的所有权股份。2010 年 3 月 12 日，MGM Mirage 宣布将出售其在 Borgata 的股份，并停止作为新泽西州的博彩被许可人开展业务。2010 年 3 月 17 日，MGM Mirage 宣布新泽西赌场控制委员会(CCC) 批准了公司与新泽西博彩执法部门(DGE)之间的和解协议，根据该协议，公司将出售其 50% 的所有权对 Borgata 的股份。

 

2014 年 9 月，CCC 在发现何超琼在澳门MGM的掌控权已被削弱后，撤销了先前的决定，允许MGM重新进入该州。

 

MGM于 2016 年 5 月同意以 9 亿美元现金和承担的债务购买博伊德在 Borgata 的 50% 股份。MGM随后以11.8 亿美元的价格将该物业出售给其附属的房地产投资信托基金，并将其租回。对 MGM Resorts 的出售于 2016 年 8 月完成。
contentEn:
Borgata Hotel Casino & Spa is a hotel, casino, and spa in Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States. It is owned and operated by MGM Resorts International. The casino hotel features 2,798 rooms and is the largest hotel in New Jersey. Borgata opened in July 2003 and is the top-grossing casino in Atlantic City.

 

History

Borgata was part of a major project in Atlantic City nicknamed "The Tunnel Project", started around 1999. When Steve Wynn planned the Le Jardin in Atlantic City, he wanted to connect a $330 million 2.5-mile (4.0 km) tunnel from the Atlantic City Expressway to the new resort, later named the Atlantic City-Brigantine Connector, which would funnel incoming traffic off the Atlantic City Expressway into the city's marina district. This caused major controversy, as it would cut through a residential neighborhood; competitor Donald Trump sued Wynn for it saying that it was a "driveway" to Wynn's casino. The Tunnel Project did progress, even after Le Jardin was cancelled, and finally opened in 2001.

 

Borgata opened on July 2, 2003, at 11:45 pm, as a joint venture between MGM Mirage and Boyd Gaming. The main tower - the third tallest building in Atlantic City - is visible from many miles away due to its facade of reflective gold glass. The firms Marnell Corrao Associates of Las Vegas, and Philadelphia’s Bower Lewis and Thrower Architects (BLT) worked on the project.[2]

 

In late 2005 and early 2006, Borgata underwent a $200 million casino and retail expansion, and the new wing opened in June 2006. As part of the expansion, Borgata installed a poker room, the largest in Atlantic City. In June 2008, Borgata opened its second hotel, The Water Club.[3]

 

In early 2010, it was reported that MGM Mirage might sell its ownership share in Borgata.[4] On March 12, 2010, MGM Mirage announced it would sell its stake in Borgata and stop doing business as a gaming licensee in New Jersey.[5] On March 17, 2010, MGM Mirage announced that the New Jersey Casino Control Commission (CCC) approved the settlement agreement between the Company and the New Jersey Division of Gaming Enforcement (DGE) under which the Company would sell its 50% ownership interest in the Borgata.[6]

 

In September 2014, the CCC reversed its earlier decision and allowed MGM back into the state, after finding that Pansy Ho's role in MGM Macau had been reduced.[7]

 

MGM agreed in May 2016 to purchase Boyd's 50 percent stake in the Borgata for $900 million in cash and assumed debt.[8] MGM then sold the property to its affiliated real estate investment trust for $1.18 billion and leased it back.[9] The sale to MGM Resorts was completed in August 2016.[10]
